key.name: lock-hotkey
key.description: The keyboard shortcut to activate the stealth lock. Default is Super+Control+L.

key.name: debug-mode
key.description: Enables debugging features such as additional logging and an emergency abort hotkey. When enabled, the abort hotkey will unlock without a password.

key.name: debug-abort-hotkey
key.description: Keyboard shortcut to abort the lock when Debug Mode is enabled. This unlocks without a password and should only be used for debugging.

key.name: freeze-display
key.description: When enabled, captures screenshots of all monitors and shows them as an overlay while locked. When disabled, the lock remains active but the display is not frozen.

key.name: pause-media
key.description: When enabled, pauses all playing media (MPRIS) on lock and resumes on unlock.

key.name: lock-cursor
key.description: When enabled, replaces the system cursor with a lock cursor while locked.

key.name: cursor-bitmap-path
key.description: Optional path to an image file to use as the lock cursor. Leave empty to use the built-in cursor.

key.name: cursor-fg-rgba
key.description: Foreground (outline/details) color for the built-in lock cursor, stored as [R, G, B, A] 0-255.

key.name: cursor-bg-rgba
key.description: Background (fill) color for the built-in lock cursor, stored as [R, G, B, A] 0-255.

key.name: auto-reset-seconds
key.description: Seconds of inactivity before the password buffer is cleared. Set to 0 to disable auto reset.

key.name: lock-type
key.description: Controls how password entry behaves while locked. "stealth" shows no UI, while "normal" shows an on-screen password prompt.

key.name: normal-prompt-follow-cursor
key.description: When enabled (Normal lock type), the password prompt follows the cursor.

key.name: normal-prompt-cursor-anchor
key.description: Where to place the prompt relative to the cursor when following it: "br" bottom-right, "tr" top-right, "tl" top-left, "bl" bottom-left.

key.name: normal-prompt-offset-x
key.description: Horizontal offset (pixels) from the cursor when following it.

key.name: normal-prompt-offset-y
key.description: Vertical offset (pixels) from the cursor when following it.

key.name: normal-prompt-fixed-x
key.description: Fixed X position (pixels) for the password prompt when not following the cursor. Use -1 to center horizontally.

key.name: normal-prompt-fixed-y
key.description: Fixed Y position (pixels) for the password prompt when not following the cursor. Use -1 to center vertically.

key.name: normal-prompt-css
key.description: Optional inline CSS applied to the password prompt container in Normal lock type.

key.name: normal-prompt-custom-js
key.description: Optional JavaScript snippet executed for the password prompt (Normal lock type). Receives a context object; use with care.

key.name: debug-show-info
key.description: When Debug Mode is enabled, controls whether the on-screen debug overlay is shown.

key.name: debug-abort-use-lock-hotkey
key.description: When enabled, the Debug Abort Hotkey is forced to match the Lock Hotkey. When disabled, you can set a separate Debug Abort Hotkey.

key.name: debug-abort-hotkey-custom
key.description: Stores the user-defined Debug Abort Hotkey when "Use Lock Hotkey for Abort" is enabled. When the option is disabled, this value is restored back to Debug Abort Hotkey.
